trans-unit.source: Using the Azure Storage Blob Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure Storage Blob Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Azure Storage Blob Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Azure Storage Blob Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Connect to your Azure Storage Blob to upload, download, and delete blobs from the blob container.
trans-unit.target: Connect to your Azure Storage Blob to upload, download, and delete blobs from the blob container.

trans-unit.source: Connectors are used in Logic Apps as a part of a "workflow".
trans-unit.target: Connectors are used in Logic Apps as a part of a "workflow".

trans-unit.source: Triggers are events that happen.
trans-unit.target: Triggers are events that happen.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.

trans-unit.source: An Action is the result of the trigger.
trans-unit.target: An Action is the result of the trigger.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated, send an alert to the salesperson.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated, send an alert to the salesperson.

trans-unit.source: Or, when a new customer is added, send a welcome email to the new customer.
trans-unit.target: Or, when a new customer is added, send a welcome email to the new customer.

trans-unit.source: The Storage Blob Connector can be used as an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.
trans-unit.target: The Storage Blob Connector can be used as an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.

trans-unit.source: Currently, there are no triggers for the Storage Blob Connector.
trans-unit.target: Currently, there are no triggers for the Storage Blob Connector.

trans-unit.source: The Storage Blob Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:
trans-unit.target: The Storage Blob Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source:
• Get Blob: Get a specific Blob from the container
  • Upload Blob: Upload a new Blob or update an existing Blob
  • Delete Blob: Delete a specific Blob from a Container
  • List Blobs: List all blobs in a directory
  • Snapshot Blob: Create a read-only snapshot of a Specific Blob
  • Copy Blob: Create a new Blob by copying from another Blob. The source Blob may be in the same account or in another account.
trans-unit.target:
• Get Blob: Get a specific Blob from the container
  • Upload Blob: Upload a new Blob or update an existing Blob
  • Delete Blob: Delete a specific Blob from a Container
  • List Blobs: List all blobs in a directory
  • Snapshot Blob: Create a read-only snapshot of a Specific Blob
  • Copy Blob: Create a new Blob by copying from another Blob. The source Blob may be in the same account or in another account.

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Search for “Blob”: <linkText>Select Azure Storage Blob Connector</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Search for “Blob”: <linkText>Select Azure Storage Blob Connector</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select it, and select Create.
trans-unit.target: Select it, and select Create.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following package settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following package settings:

trans-unit.source: Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- Container/SAS URI | Yes | Enter the URI of the Blob Container. The URI may also include the SAS token. For example, enter http://storageaccountname.blob.core.windows.net/containername or http://storageaccountname.blob.core.windows.net/containername?sr=c&si=mypolicy&sig=signatureblah Access Key | No | Enter a valid primary or secondary storage account access key. If you are using the SAS token for authentication, leave this field empty.
trans-unit.target: Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- Container/SAS URI | Yes | Enter the URI of the Blob Container. The URI may also include the SAS token. For example, enter http://storageaccountname.blob.core.windows.net/containername or http://storageaccountname.blob.core.windows.net/containername?sr=c&si=mypolicy&sig=signatureblah Access Key | No | Enter a valid primary or secondary storage account access key. If you are using the SAS token for authentication, leave this field empty.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create Azure Storage Blob Connector</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create Azure Storage Blob Connector</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: Once the Azure Storage Blob connector has been created, it can now be added to your workflow.
trans-unit.target: Once the Azure Storage Blob connector has been created, it can now be added to your workflow.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App: New -> Web+Mobile -> LogicApp.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App: New -> Web+Mobile -> LogicApp.

trans-unit.source: Enter the properties for your Logic App: <linkText>Create Logic App</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Enter the properties for your Logic App: <linkText>Create Logic App</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Triggers and actions.
trans-unit.target: Click Triggers and actions.

trans-unit.source: The workfow designer opens: <linkText>Logic App empty flow designer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: The workfow designer opens: <linkText>Logic App empty flow designer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your Azure Storage Blob Connector from the right pane.
trans-unit.target: Select your Azure Storage Blob Connector from the right pane.

trans-unit.source: The connector lists the actions available: <linkText>List of Azure Storage Blob Actions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: The connector lists the actions available: <linkText>List of Azure Storage Blob Actions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, let's use the Upload Blob action: Inputs of Upload Blob action
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, let's use the Upload Blob action: Inputs of Upload Blob action

trans-unit.source: Enter the input values and select the check mark to complete the configuration:
trans-unit.target: Enter the input values and select the check mark to complete the configuration:

trans-unit.source: Input | Description --- | --- Blob Path | Determines the path of the Blob to be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Input | Description --- | --- Blob Path | Determines the path of the Blob to be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: The path is interpreted relative to the configured Container path.
trans-unit.target: The path is interpreted relative to the configured Container path.

trans-unit.source: Blob Write Content | Enter the Content and the properties of the Blob to be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Blob Write Content | Enter the Content and the properties of the Blob to be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: Content Transfer Encoding | Enter none or Base64.
trans-unit.target: Content Transfer Encoding | Enter none or Base64.

trans-unit.source: Overwrite | When set to true, the existing Blob is overwritten.
trans-unit.target: Overwrite | When set to true, the existing Blob is overwritten.

trans-unit.source: When set to false, it returns an error if a Blob already exists at the same path.
trans-unit.target: When set to false, it returns an error if a Blob already exists at the same path.

trans-unit.source: Note that the configured Azure Storage Blob Upload Blob action shows both input parameters as well as output parameters.
trans-unit.target: Note that the configured Azure Storage Blob Upload Blob action shows both input parameters as well as output parameters.

trans-unit.source: In the previous screen shot, the Content value can be an expression:
trans-unit.target: In the previous screen shot, the Content value can be an expression:

trans-unit.source: You can set it to any value that you want.
trans-unit.target: You can set it to any value that you want.

trans-unit.source: The expression takes the output of the logic app trigger and uses it as the content of the file to be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: The expression takes the output of the logic app trigger and uses it as the content of the file to be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: For example, you want to use the output of a transform.
trans-unit.target: For example, you want to use the output of a transform.

trans-unit.source: In that scenario, the expression would be:
trans-unit.target: In that scenario, the expression would be:

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
